content.question: Two charged particles with charges of <math alttext="Positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="Positive 4 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> on a line are a distance <math alttext="6 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mi>r</mi></math> apart from each other, as shown in the figure. An observer records the magnitude of the electric field first at a distance <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> away from the left particle, and continues to record the magnitude of the electric field consecutively at <math alttext="2 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>r</mi></math>, <math alttext="3 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>r</mi></math>, <math alttext="4 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>r</mi></math> and <math alttext="5 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mi>r</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly describes the observed magnitudes of electric field during the recordings?

choices.label: The magnitude of the electric field steadily increases.
The magnitude of the electric field remains constant.
The magnitude of the electric field first increases, then decreases.
The magnitude of the electric field first decreases, then increases

content.answer: The magnitude of the electric field first decreases, then increases
